Jeremy Kyle heaped praise on a churchgoing man he described as his "favourite guest ever" before a heartbreaking revelation. 
From a sharp suit to describing the hymen as "the door god puts there to avoid used goods", guest Alan was a hit with the TV host and his studio audience as he revealed the moment he fell in love with wife Louise. 
The Mormon met his future bride on the bus to church, and he was confused when she took back a previous confession that she'd had a three month affair before their wedding. Jeremy called Alan his favourite ever guest (Photo: ITV) He was a hit with the studio audience (Photo: ITV) 
"I don't think she's as religious as maybe I might be," he said, as Jeremy couldn't resist praising him. 
"You're my favourite guest in ages - I love you," he laughed. He certainly had charm (Photo: ITV) The lie detector test said Louise cheated on him (Photo: ITV) 
The segment had both the audience and crew in stitches - particularly with Jeremy's puns as Alan said he thought Louise was a virgin when they met, "but there was no hymen". 
Jez quipped: "Isn't that what you sing in church?" They're willing to work to get things back on track (Photo: ITV) 
Graham later joked to the host: "You're obsessed with the hymen!" 
Although Louise failed every lie detector test, the couple were ready to work hard for the sake of their relationship and family. Like us on Facebook
